full_text:
Re: Fwd: Jeffrey Epstein
From
(b)(6) (b)(7)(C)
To
Lee Plourde
Date
2019/08/11 12:54
Subject:
Re: Fwd: Jeffrey Epstein
Attachments:
TEXT.htm, Mime.822
... This graph is pretty explosive: A person with knowledge of the investigation said that when the decision was made to remove Mr. Epstein from suicide watch, the jail informed the Justice Department that Mr. Epstein would have a cellmate and that a guard “would look into his cell” every 30 minutes.
But that was apparently not done, the person said.
“
(b)(6) (b)(7)(C)
Senior Editor, writer
The Daily Beast
M: 267-257-(b)(6)
Facebook, Twitter, Instagram: @ (b)(6), (b)(7)(C)
From: (b)(6) (b)(7)(C)
Sent: Sunday, August 11, 2019 12:52:21 PM
To: Lee Plourde (b)(6) @bop.gov>
Subject: Re: Fwd: Jeffrey Epstein
Hi, I know you are busy. Following up on this. Also wondering about a few details I see out there:
was this already known? In addition, the jail had transferred his cellmate and allowed Mr. Epstein to be housed alone in a cell just two weeks after he had been taken off suicide watch, a decision that also violated the jail’s normal procedure, two officials said.
“
(b)(6) (b)(7)(C)
Senior Editor, writer
The Daily Beast
M: 267-257-(b)(6)
Facebook, Twitter, Instagram: @ (b)(6), (b)(7)(C)
From: (b)(6) (b)(7)(C)
Sent: Saturday, August 10, 2019 3:17:52 PM
To: Lee Plourde (b)(6) @bop.gov>
Subject: Re: Fwd: Jeffrey Epstein
Thanks, Lee.
1. When was Epstein taken off suicide watch?
2. How long was he on suicide watch?
3. What unit in the jail was he housed?
4. Was he by himself?
5. What’s protocol for watching him at 6:30 in the morning? And in general during a 24 hour period?
6. Is there an internal investigation? Are the guard(s) and/or supervisors placed on modified duty/or some
Page 87
DOJ-OGR-00023505

Hi, I know you are busy. Following up on this. Also wondering about a few details I see out there:
was this already known? In addition, the jail had transferred his cellmate and allowed Mr. Epstein to be housed alone in a cell just two weeks after he had been taken off suicide watch, a decision that also violated the jail’s normal procedure, two officials said.

4. Was he by himself?
5. What’s protocol for watching him at 6:30 in the morning? And in general during a 24 hour period?
6. Is there an internal investigation? Are the guard(s) and/or supervisors placed on modified duty/or some

additional_notes: The document appears to be an email chain discussing Jeffrey Epstein's treatment in jail. The emails contain redactions of personal information.
